isis.stitle: TSI 08-12-01 - Engine Idle Shutdown Timer (IST) Regulations

geninfo.para: Beginning in 2008 MY, all International® MaxxForce™ engines certified for sale in the state of California will conform to mandatory California Air Resources Board (CARB) Engine Shutdown System (ESS) regulations.
The Idle Shutdown Timer (IST) feature allows the Electronic Control Module (ECM) to shut down the engine during extended engine idle times.
The prior function of the IST is available on CA ESS exempt and Federally certified engines (school buses, emergency and military vehicles).
Idle Shutdown WarningThirty seconds before IST-defined engine shutdown, a vehicle instrument panel indicator activates. There are two types of indicators:

item.para: Amber flashing idle shutdown indicator for multiplex electrical systems.
Red flashing indicator with audible alarm for non-multiplex electrical systems.

geninfo.para: This continues until the engine shuts down or the low idle shutdown timer is reset.

svcproc.title: Engine Idle Shutdown Timer for California ESS Compliant Engines
svcproc.para: Engine idle duration is limited for ESS compliant engines as follows:

item.para: When vehicle parking brake is set, the idle shutdown time is limited to the CARB requirement of 5 minutes.
When vehicle parking brake is released, the idle shutdown time is limited to the CARB requirement of 15 minutes.

svcproc.para: The duration of CARB mandated values can be reduced by programming the customer IST programmable parameter to a value lower than 15 minutes. Adjusting this parameter reduces overall system shutdown time as follows:

item.para: Adjusting parameter value between 5 and 15 minutes reduces idle shutdown time with the vehicle parking brake released. The default value of 5 minutes for the vehicle parking brake "set" condition remains unaffected.
Adjusting parameter value between 2 and 5 minutes reduces idle time for both the vehicle parking brake "released" and "set" conditions.

svcproc.para: While the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is installed, idle shutdown time is factory defaulted to 60 minutes and cannot be adjusted. If the IST is enabled, the Cold Ambient Protection (CAP) will not function.

note.para: The CARB IST feature is factory programmed. Customers can not turn IST off for ESS compliant engines.

svcproc.para: The following conditions must be true for the idle shutdown timer to activate in all modes. Any change of the "true" state of one or more of these conditions will reset or disable the IST.

item.para: Manual Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) regeneration is inactive (not enabled).

Steady driveline state (no transition detected). No change in the state of the clutch switch (manual transmission) or transmission shifter between the in-gear position and neutral or park (Automatic transmission).
Power Take Off (PTO) Remote mode disabled.
Engine coolant temperature greater than 15.6 ºC (60 ºF).
No active coolant temperature sensor diagnostic faults.
No active intake air temperature sensor diagnostic faults.
Engine is operating in run mode or in active diagnostic tool mode.
Vehicle speed is less than 1.25 miles/hr.
No active vehicle speed diagnostic faults.
PTO Control is in Off or Standby mode.
Engine speed less than 750 RPM for MaxxForce™ 5, 7, DT, 9 and 10.
Engine speed less than 650 RPM for MaxxForce™ 11 and 13.
Steady accelerator pedal position (no transition detected from any pre-set position).
Steady brake pedal state (no transition detected from any pre-set state).
Steady parking brake state (CAN message) (no transition detected from any pre-set state).

svcproc.title: Engine Idle Shutdown Timer (Federal-Optional)
svcproc.para: Idle time can be programmed from 5 to 120 minutes. While the EST is installed, the IST function will be active with the programmed shutdown time in effect. Parking brake transitions reset the idle timer in all 2008 engines. If the IST is enabled, the Cold Ambient Protection (CAP) will not function.
The following conditions must be true for the idle shutdown timer to activate. Any change to the "true" state of one or more of these conditions will reset or disable the IST.

randlist.title: Common Enable Conditions for All Federal IST Options

item.para: Manual Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) regeneration is inactive (not enabled).

Steady driveline state (no transition detected). No change in the state of the clutch switch (manual transmission) or transmission shifter between the in-gear position and neutral or park (Automatic transmission).
PTO Remote mode disabled.
Intake air temperature greater than 15.6 ºC (60 ºF) (MFG Default, Customer adjustable parameter).
Intake air temperature lower than 44 ºC (112 ºF) (MFG Default, Customer adjustable parameter).
Engine coolant temperature greater than 60 ºC (140 ºF).
No active coolant temperature sensor diagnostic faults.
No active intake air temperature sensor diagnostic faults.
Engine is operating in run mode or in active diagnostic tool mode.
Vehicle speed is less than 1.25 miles/hr.
No active vehicle speed diagnostic faults.
Steady parking brake state (CAN message). No transition detected from any pre-set state.

svcproc.para: Additional operation enable conditions depending on selected Federal IST operation mode:

randlist.title: Federal IST Mode 1: PTO Operation Option Enable Conditions

item.para: PTO Control is in Off or Standby mode.
Engine speed less than 750 RPM for MaxxForce™ 5, 7, DT, 9 and 10.
Engine speed less than 650 RPM for MaxxForce™ 11 and 13.
Accelerator pedal position is less than 2 %.
No active accelerator pedal diagnostic faults.
Steady brake pedal state (No transition detected).
No active brake system diagnostic faults.

randlist.title: Federal IST Mode 2: No Load / Light Load Limit Option Enable Conditions

item.para: Accelerator pedal position is less than 2 %.
No active accelerator pedal diagnostic faults.
Steady brake pedal state (No transition detected).
No active brake system diagnostic faults.
Engine reported fuel usage (load) is less than ECM specified limit (factory calibrated, not customer adjustable).

randlist.title: Federal IST Mode 3: Tamper Proof Option Enable Conditions

item.para: Engine reported fuel usage (load) is less than ECM specified limit (factory calibrated, not customer adjustable).
Steady accelerator pedal position (no transition detected from any pre-set position).
Steady brake pedal state (no transition detected from any pre-set state).
